author: @https://twitter.com/KlenderJoey
title: Elon Musk and Donald Trump receive jabs from UAW chief -- but what he said is false
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk and former President Donald Trump both received jabs from UAW President Shawn Fain on Wednesday â€” but what Fain said based on a proven to be false story from the Wall Street Journal. The Wall Street Journal reported several weeks ago that [Musk was planning to donate $45 million a month](https://www.teslarati.com/elon-musk-45-million-monthly-pro-trump-super-pac-report/) to Trumpâ€™s new political action committee (PAC). However, both Musk and President Trumpâ€™s campaign denied the report, with Musk calling it â€œfake gnus.â€ â€” Elon Musk (@elonmusk) [July 16, 2024] Trumpâ€™s campaign denied that Musk would be donating $45 million a month to the former Presidentâ€™s bid to regain status in the White House. Nevertheless, that did not stop Fain from calling Trump a â€œselloutâ€ after he switched up his tune on electric vehicles. [Trump said he â€œhad to supportâ€ EVs](https://www.teslarati.com/trump-for-electric-cars-musk-endorsement/) because of Muskâ€™s support, as the Tesla frontman said last month he was backing the 45th President after a failed assassination attempt in Butler, Pennsylvania. Fain said (via [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/world/us/uaw-chief-criticizes-trump-ties-musk-while-campaigning-harris-2024-08-07/)): â€œFor months, Donald Trump has gone around trashing our state, trashing our industry, trashing the American autoworker, saying he was against electric vehicles. And then something happenedâ€¦We saw Elon Musk announce he was going to give Donald Trump $45 million dollars a month. And all of a sudden, guess what, Trump changed his tune.â€ The UAW has already endorsed Kamala Harris for President, which is no surprise considering the unionâ€™s support from Democratic candidates, especially President Joe Biden. Musk has been highly critical of the UAW for years and has called for officials to [come hold a vote at the companyâ€™s factories](https://www.teslarati.com/tesla-elon-musk-invites-uaw-union-vote-fremont-factory/). The UAW has not taken Musk up on his offer. Iâ€™d love to hear from you! If you have any comments, concerns, or questions, please email me at [joey@teslarati.com](mailto:joey@teslarati.com). You can also reach me on Twitter [@KlenderJoey](http://twitter.com/klenderjoey), or if you have news tips, you can email us at [tips@teslarati.com](mailto:tips@teslarati.com).

author: Our Correspondent
title: Higher Education defeat KRL in President's Trophy match
text:
KARACHI: Higher Education defeated KRL by 130 runs, SBP won against PTV by an innings and 106 runs, SNGPL beat OGDCL by 7 wickets and Ghani Glass crushed Eshal Associates by 229 runs as four matches of the Presidentâ€™s Trophy Grade 1 were decided Thursday.
KRL was given a target of 194 runs to win against Higher Education at the NBP Sports Complex, but the entire team was dismissed for only 63 runs. Left-arm fast bowler Muhammad Azab took 4-13.
Earlier, Higher Education were dismissed for 239 runs in second innings. Obaid Shahid scored 72 runs. Left-arm fast bowler Arshadullah took 5 wickets for 65 runs. He bowled well in the first innings as well, taking 5 wickets for 31 runs.
It was the second consecutive match in which he has taken 10 wickets. Earlier, he had taken 11 wickets in the match against Wapda. At SBP Sports Complex, PTV started their second innings against State Bank at 52 for no loss on the third day and needed 270 runs to avoid an innings defeat but the entire team was dismissed for 215 runs. Shamil Hussain scored 49 runs. Mohammad Ismail took 5-92. He took 4 wickets in the first innings.
At UBL Sports Complex, defending champions SNGPL were given a target of 178 runs to win against OGDCL, which they achieved for the loss of 3 wickets. Qasim Akram remained not out on 58 runs. Abid Ali was dismissed for 49 and Saad Khan scored 47 runs.
Earlier, OGDCL were bowled out for 178 runs in their second innings. Adil Amin scored 54 runs. Shahzad Gul grabbed 4-33. At Oval cricket ground, Chasing a target of 329 runs against Ghani Glass, Eshal Associates were bowled out for just 99 runs. Ubaid Shah took 4-44. Afaq Afridi took three wickets. Earlier, Ghani Glass were bowled out for 242 runs in its second innings. Sharjeel Khan scored 53 runs and Ramiz Junior scored 50 runs.
